name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Texas research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Texas ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Texas ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Texas research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Texas research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Texas Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Learn about Texas genealogy resources.

    ☆ AC—Researching Your Relatives From the Lone Star State—28:52
    ☆ AR—Family History Research in Texas

  3. Follow this research study for Texas ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Texas Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Texas research.

    ☆ AC—Texas State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Texas Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Texas Record Finder


    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about colonial records in Texas.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Texas


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Texas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Texas

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Texas African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Texas.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Texas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Texas
Additional Records

1. Explore Texas historical resources on FamilySearch.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Texas archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Texas archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Texas archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Texas Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Texas State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about information in Texas archives in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Major Repositories—4:25

  3. Explore the ☆Portal to Texas History site.
  4. Explore the ☆State Archives and Libraries site for Texas.
  5. Explore ☆Texas Dept. of Archives collection.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Texas genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Texas research on the FamilySearch site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Texas ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Texas city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Texas Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Texas city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Texas city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Texas ☆historical directories by county (scroll down on the left).
  6. Explore additional links for Texas city directories records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Texas vital and census records.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Texas research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Texas County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Texas.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Texas Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Texas research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Texas Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Texas Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Texas Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Texas.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Texas research.
  2. Explore the Texas research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Texas research.
  4. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Texas research.
  5. Explore Texas research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Texas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Texas Societies
  2. Visit the Texas State Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  3. Get help at a family history center in Texas.
Regional/Local Societies
